GIS.geometry

Class GISPolyline

  • java.lang.Object
    • GIS.geometry.Geometry
      • GIS.geometry.GISPolyline
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GISPolygon

    public class GISPolyline
extends Geometry
    Creates an Polyline Object. Points can be added to the empty line with the Method "addPoint()", that will add a Point Object to the Point ArrayList. To write Feature in DB or CSV the coordinates can be transformed to the right format using "writeAsText()". To read it from a DB or CSV use "textToPoint()"

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float length
      the length of the line
      java.util.ArrayList<GISPoint> pointlist
      An ArrayList of Point objects which define the geometry of the Polyline

      • Fields inherited from class GIS.geometry.Geometry

        id, type

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GISPolyline()
      Constructor calls the constructor of the super class (Geometry) and sets the type

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPoint(GISPoint point)
      Adds a point object to the attribute pointlist return true when processed sucessfull
      void calculateLength()
      calculate the length of a Polyline, stored in Attribute length
      boolean geometryAsTextToLine(java.lang.String geometry)
      when receiving a feature geometry from a DB/CSV it will be stored in the string: "1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765" textToPoint("1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765") will split the string at the "," to receive the different points. " " spereates their x and y coordinates.
      float getLength()
      returns the value of attribute length of a Polyline (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use calculateLength)
      void setTypeToPolygon()
      The class GISPolygon inherits from GISPolyline and must be able to change the type of the Geometry class to "Polygon".
      java.lang.String writeGeometryAsText()
      write the points of a line so that they can be stored as a string in a DB/CSV and be reconstructed to a Point when loaded.

        getID, getType

    • Constructor Detail

      • GISPolyline

        public GISPolyline()
        Constructor calls the constructor of the super class (Geometry) and sets the type

    • Method Detail

      • setTypeToPolygon

        public void setTypeToPolygon()
        The class GISPolygon inherits from GISPolyline and must be able to change the type of the Geometry class to "Polygon". This method provides that functionality.

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(GISPoint point)
        Adds a point object to the attribute pointlist return true when processed sucessfull
        Parameters:
        point - an instance of the class GISPoint

      • writeGeometryAsText

        public java.lang.String writeGeometryAsText()
        write the points of a line so that they can be stored as a string in a DB/CSV and be reconstructed to a Point when loaded. should be something like that: x1 = 1.234 y1 = 5.678 x2 = 4.321 y2 = 8.765 writeAsText() "1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765" - 2 seperators: "," for different points " " for the two coordinates of a point
        Returns:
        String with the Geometry as readable Text

      • geometryAsTextToLine

        public boolean geometryAsTextToLine(java.lang.String geometry)
        when receiving a feature geometry from a DB/CSV it will be stored in the string: "1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765" textToPoint("1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765") will split the string at the "," to receive the different points. " " spereates their x and y coordinates. For each coordinate pair a Point object will be generated and stored in the ArrayList "pointlist". return true when processed sucessfull
        Parameters:
        geometry - a String received from writeGeometryAsText()
        Returns:
        true when method was sucessfull, false for errors

      • calculateLength

        public void calculateLength()
        calculate the length of a Polyline, stored in Attribute length

      • getLength

        public float getLength()
        returns the value of attribute length of a Polyline (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use calculateLength)
        Returns:
        Length of the Polyline
